abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Rehabilitation Project involves
            the rehabilitation and reconstruction of roads in three
            regions - Sihanoukville Municipality, Phnom Penh
            Municipality, and Siem Reap. This Resettlement Action Plan
            (RAP) is a guide to define which households will be
            negatively affected by the project, where they are located,
            what compensation measures are to be provided, and how and
            when these measures must be implemented. A Cambodian
            nongovernmental organization (NGO) undertook a survey and
            found out that about 1818 households would be affected by
            the project and eligible for compensation, and that almost
            700 structures would have to be removed during the project.
            Compensation available are: compensation for loss of land
            and assets; compensation for temporary loss of livelihood;
            compensation for loss of community structures/facilities;
            and a flat shifting allowance. Monitoring of RAP
            implementation will be conducted by an external auditor (NGO
            or consultant) periodically.
